conclusion: To determine how the number of molecules colliding with the unit area of the wall per unit time changes as the gas transitions from state C to state D, analyze the P-V diagram and processes involved.
A → B is an isothermal process where temperature remains constant.
C → D is an isothermal process where temperature remains constant.
p1 V1 = p2 V2 where p1 and V1 are pressure and volume at point C, and p2 and V2 are pressure and volume at point D.
From the diagram, V_C > V_D indicating volume decreases from C to D.
As volume V decreases, pressure p must increase to keep pV constant.
p_C V_C = p_D V_D and since V_C > V_D, it follows that p_D > p_C.
The number of molecules colliding with the unit area of the wall per unit time increases from state C to state D.
